decks.notes: The deck focuses on gaining control of the board through various removal spells and stealing opponent's creatures. It uses cards like Claim the Firstborn and The Akroan War to disrupt the opponent's game plan while utilizing sacrifice effects with cards like Woe Strider and Village Rites to generate value. The deck also has powerful finishers in Korvold, Fae-Cursed King and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger to close out the game. Overall, the deck aims to control the game tempo and win through attrition and resource advantage.

This deck focuses on utilizing mill and control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while efficiently drawing cards and managing resources. It aims to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage, ultimately leading to victory through decking out the opponent. By utilizing efficient creatures and spells, it aims to maintain control of the board and disrupt the opponent's plans while steadily advancing towards its win condition. The deck's key strategy lies in managing resources effectively to outlast the opponent and grind out a victory through strategic decision-making and resource management.

The main idea behind this deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's strategy while slowly building up a win condition. The deck focuses on efficiently dealing with threats through removal spells like Heartless Act and Extinction Event, countering spells with cards like Negate and Neutralize, and generating card advantage with cards like Mazemind Tome and Shark Typhoon. The win condition is typically through creating tokens with Shark Typhoon or playing powerful threats like Lochmere Serpent and Ashiok, Nightmare Muse.

The main focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to put pressure on the opponent early in the game with efficient creatures like Questing Beast, Brushfire Elemental, and Lovestruck Beast. The deck also aims to control the board with removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Embereth Shieldbreaker. The Great Henge and Embercleave provide additional power to the creatures, while cards like The Akroan War and Primal Might can help swing the game in your favor. The mana base is optimized for consistent play and easy access to all colors needed.

The deck focuses on gaining control of the board through removal spells and enchantments like Glass Casket and The Akroan War. It also features cards like Harmonious Archon to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast and Transmogrify are used to cheat powerful creatures into play, while Elspeth, Sun's Nemesis provides recurring threats. The mana base is designed to support the Boros color combination with dual lands and Fabled Passage. Overall, the deck aims to control the game until it can establish a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on using mill as a win condition while controlling the opponent's board and hand. By utilizing cards like Ruin Crab, Into the Story, and Drown in the Loch, the deck aims to deplete the opponent's library quickly and efficiently. Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Soaring Thought-Thief also support the mill strategy while providing early aggression. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional recursion and value. The deck includes counter spells, removal, and card draw to maintain control throughout the game.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and combat tricks. The key strategy is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Questing Beast, while also utilizing powerful spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Embercleave to deal substantial damage and control the battlefield. The inclusion of cards like The Great Henge and Vivien, Monsters' Advocate provide additional value and card advantage. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and close out the game before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures and generating card advantage through abilities like The Great Henge and Trail of Crumbs. By efficiently ramping with cards like Gilded Goose and Tangled Florahedron, the deck aims to establish board presence early and keep up the pressure with aggressive creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Wicked Wolf. The inclusion of cards like Kogla, the Titan Ape and Feasting Troll King provides strong late-game options to continue the assault and close out the game.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and disrupting their mana base. By using cards like Eliminate, Drown in the Loch, Heartless Act, and Voracious Greatshark, the deck aims to control the board and prevent the opponent from developing their game plan. Cards like Mazemind Tome and Castle Vantress provide card advantage and selection, while cards like Jwari Disruption and Field of Ruin disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck also includes some finishers like Lochmere Serpent and Shark Typhoon to close out the game.

The focus of this Dimir Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with a mix of aggressive creatures like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Ruin Crab, while disrupting the opponent with counterspells like Essence Scatter and Drown in the Loch. By utilizing cards like Soaring Thought-Thief to enhance mill strategies and Zareth San, the Trickster to steal opponent's creatures, the deck aims to effectively control the battlefield and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of damage and mill tactics. The mana base is designed to support both early aggression and late-game power with powerful land options like Temple of Deceit and Clearwater Pathway.

This deck focuses on aggressive, creature-based gameplay, utilizing powerful creatures like Questing Beast and Brushfire Elemental to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Embercleave and The Great Henge allows for additional damage output and card advantage. The deck also includes removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Fire Prophecy to deal with opposing threats. The mana base is optimized for consistency with Fabled Passage and dual lands, ensuring that the deck can consistently play its threats and spells on curve.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Lovestruck Beast to quickly overwhelm opponents. The key strategy is to curve out efficiently and utilize powerful combat tricks like Embercleave to push through damage and maintain pressure. The deck also includes removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Fire Prophecy to deal with opposing threats. The inclusion of cards like The Great Henge and Vivien, Monsters' Advocate provide additional value and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to be proactive and fast-paced in order to win the game quickly.

The main concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Lovestruck Beast, supported by removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Fire Prophecy. The deck aims to pressure the opponent early and maintain an aggressive stance throughout the game. The Great Henge provides additional card draw and life gain, while Embercleave can be a game-winning finisher. This deck utilizes a combination of powerful creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent and secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and burn spells. Torbran, Anax, and Embercleave are key cards that pump up the damage output of the creatures, while Bonecrusher Giant and Phoenix of Ash provide additional reach and removal. The deck is designed to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game, with a mix of efficient creatures and versatile burn spells. The mana base is streamlined to maximize the chances of curving out and enabling the aggressive game plan.

Utilize the high-powered creatures and removal spells to control the game, ramping up your mana base with Cultivate and Genesis Ultimatum to quickly overwhelm your opponent with big threats like Terror of the Peaks and Beanstalk Giant. The addition of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion allows for even more damage output, while cards like Brazen Borrower and Bonecrusher Giant help to disrupt your opponent's game plan. The deck aims to dominate the board and outvalue your opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's moves through various removal spells and counterspells while drawing cards and ramping up mana to eventually play powerful threats like Terror of the Peaks and Genesis Ultimatum. The key strategy is to outvalue the opponent with card advantage and efficient removal, while also utilizing the companion Obosh, the Preypiercer to deal extra damage with odd-costed spells. The deck aims to establish board control and overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and game-winning spells.
